quiz.title: Solving One-Variable Equations (Quiz 5)
quiz.subtitle: Unit 2 Quiz 5: Solving Equations with Fractions
quiz.subject: Mathematics

questions.question: Solve: $\frac{3}{4}x - 2 = \frac{1}{2}x + 5$
questions.explanation: Multiply all terms by LCM 4: $3x - 8 = 2x + 20$. Subtract $2x$: $x - 8 = 20$. Add $8$: $x = 28$.

questions.question: Solve: $\frac{x}{2} + \frac{x}{3} = 10$
questions.explanation: Multiply all terms by LCM 6: $3x + 2x = 60$. Combine: $5x = 60$. Divide: $x = 12$.

questions.question: Solve: $1\frac{1}{2}x - 4 = \frac{5}{6}x + 2$
questions.explanation: Convert mixed number: $\frac{3}{2}x - 4 = \frac{5}{6}x + 2$. Multiply by LCM 6: $9x - 24 = 5x + 12$. Subtract $5x$: $4x - 24 = 12$. Add $24$: $4x = 36$. Divide: $x = 9$.

questions.question: Solve: $\frac{1}{4}(8x - 12) = 2x - 3$
questions.explanation: Distribute $\frac{1}{4}$: $2x - 3 = 2x - 3$. Subtract $2x$: $-3 = -3$. True statement without variable = identity with infinite solutions.

questions.question: Solve: $\frac{x}{2} - \frac{1}{5} = \frac{3x}{10} + \frac{1}{2}$
questions.explanation: Multiply all terms by LCM 10: $5x - 2 = 3x + 5$. Subtract $3x$: $2x - 2 = 5$. Add $2$: $2x = 7$. Divide: $x = \frac{7}{2}$.

questions.question: Solve: $\frac{2}{5}x + \frac{1}{3} = \frac{2}{3}x - \frac{1}{5}$
questions.explanation: Multiply all terms by LCM 15: $6x + 5 = 10x - 3$. Subtract $6x$: $5 = 4x - 3$. Add $3$: $8 = 4x$. Divide: $x = 2$.
